body.name: USB Microphone for Laptop and Desktop Computer, High Sensitivity for Clear Call, Plug-and-Play, High Gain, Cordless Mini-Sized Portable, Ideal for Work & Study
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 52 mins
features: HIGH SENSITIVITY for CLEAR CALL - This portable USB microphone adpots a 6*10mm high sensitivity condensor microphone to capture clear voice, the audio signal processed by multi levels of audio gain amplifier and advanced ADC module, it provides crystal clear voice, reliable compatibility and noise cancelling. It's able to capture voice in 10ft distance clearly -it's very small, but powerful. Plug it into the computer, you'll experience better con-call immediately.

PLUG-and-PLAY - The USB 2.0 interface is widely compatible with the most computer devices (Windows, Mac, Raspberry, Linux, Chromebook & etc ) and softwares (Google Meetings, Zoom, Team, Skype & etc). Just plug it into the USB port and done. No extra driver or settings are required.

COMPACT & PORTABLE - Like a flash disk, you can put it in the pocket with ease. Carry it with your laptop, and plug it in when you need it. No more tangled cords or bulky bases hogging your desk space, This mic is on a mission to keep your workspace sleek and organized.

IDEAL REPLACEMENT - If you are looking for a quality microphone for work at home, online conferencing, online class, live streaming and webinar, this is a great choice. It's not a recording studio grade microphone, but the sound quality is better than most of laptop built-in microphones, and it's complete enough to meet your general demand.
WHAT YOU GET - Packed in a metal carrying box, and comes with 12 months warranty. For any concern, you can send us messages freely and we will respond in 24 hours.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: This portable USB microphone is designed for computer. It's widely compatible with the most computer enviroments include Windows, Mac, Linux, Chrome OS, Google Meet, Zoom, Team, Skype and etc. Features: >>>Ultra Lightweight & Compact. Never occupy your desk. You can carry it in the case with easy. >>>Plug & Play. Easy to Use: Just plug it into the USB port and done. No extra driver or settings are required. >>>Universal Compatibility. USB2.0 connection, can be compatible with all mainstream computer devices. >>>Small but Powerful. Built-in the high sensitivity (-46dB) condensor microphone and multi levels of the gain and amplifying circuit. >>>for Very Clear Call. If you are not satisfied with the built-in microphone of the laptop, if you are looking for a convenient microphone for daily use. This will be the great choice. Warmly Remind: As the sensitivity is very high, we suggest to set the input volume to 10-50 (lower than 50). Don't set the input volume too high, otherwise people may hear echo, How to adjust the input volume: For Win 10: Right Click the speaker icon in SYSTEM TRAY>> Left Click "Sound Settings>> Choose“USB PnP Sound Device" as INPUT DEVICE > click“DeviceProperties" >> move the volume slider to appropriate position.(Recommendto set it in 10-50.) For Skype: “Option">>"Audio Device">> select“USB PnP Sound Device" >> move the volume slider to appropriate position. (Recommend to set it in 10-50.) Do similar settings on other systems & Apps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and price.
reviews.reviewText: It's very easy just plug the speaker into USB port on your computer and your all set. Plus the size is perfect I didn't another object on my desk. It solved a problem plus you can set the sittings up in your Google or other Apps you may use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars About as minimalist as a mic can get
reviews.reviewText: I am reviewing the product "DUNGZDUZ USB Microphone for Laptop and Desktop Computer" on 24 January, 2024.On the bench today is this barebones USB microphone. About as minimalist as a mic can get, the whole thing fits into a case the size of a USB thumb drive. Installing it is as easy as plugging it in to an available USB-A socket; any OS released since the George W. Bush Administration should automatically detect it and present it in its list of audio devices for recording, as did my macOS device.The mic presented itself to CoreAudio, where it was listed in Audio Midi Setup as "USBAudio2.0" with these specifications: Input 1 channel Format: 48,000Khz, 16-bit Integer and no outputs.Sound quality is acceptable for issuing Siri commands or giving dictation, or even recording a classroom lecture; however, I wouldn't use this to record a speech or -- heaven forbid -- a musical performance. It wasn't made or marketed for such uses where precise fidelity is critical. For casual uses as described, though, it is a good inexpensive, compact solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Plugged into a 2010 Mac Pro and immediately start working not high dollar works great for Dictation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works as advertised. Very sensitive mic in a small package.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Mighty Mic in a Metal Box
reviews.reviewText: If James Bond were a microphone, he'd probably be this USB wonder – compact, discreet, and ready for action! Let's dive into the espionage of audio quality, shall we?**HIGH SENSITIVITY for CLEAR CALL:**This microphone boasts a sensitivity that could pick up a pin drop in a hurricane. The 6*10mm condenser is like the secret agent of the audio world, capturing voices with the precision of a surgeon. If only it could eavesdrop on your neighbor's gossip, too.**PLUG-and-PLAY:**No need for a crash course in technology here. It's as easy as plugging in a toaster and less likely to cause a kitchen disaster. USB 2.0, the James Bond of interfaces, smoothly infiltrates any computer device – Windows, Mac, Raspberry, Linux, and even Chromebook, because who said spies can't be versatile?**COMPACT & PORTABLE:**You can slip into your pocket like a secret weapon – move over 007! No more tangled cords or bulky bases hogging your desk space. This mic is on a mission to keep your workspace sleek and covert.**IDEAL REPLACEMENT:**This mic steps in like a silent guardian for work-at-home warriors, online class heroes, and webinar wizards. Not quite a recording studio legend but a hero in the battle against awful laptop microphones. It's the sidekick you didn't know you needed.**WHAT YOU GET:**Not just a microphone – it's a full-on secret agent in a metal carrying box. Because nothing says "I'm serious about audio quality," like a metal box. And don't forget the 12-month warranty – even spies need a safety net.In conclusion, this USB microphone might not make you the next pop sensation, but it will make your virtual meetings sound like a blockbuster film. It's the unsung hero of the work-from-home world, ready to save your audio reputation one call at a time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great device for non-professional use
reviews.reviewText: This is a great little microphone device for the price. It was super easy to setup and worked right out of the gate on my W11 laptop. While the sound quality won't blow you away, it will do the job for taking notes on your laptop, etc. I was going to use this for song writing (scratch recordings, only), but I quickly decided that my laptop's built-in microphone was more practical. I don't think this microphone would be sensitive enough to use for anything other than rudimentary recording, but the price is dirt cheap and makes this a PERFECT tool for your audio toolbox. Recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Effective low-profile sound dongle with built-in microphone.
reviews.reviewText: After years of having iMacs with built-in microphones, I recently purchased a Mac Studio that lacks an internal microphone. The Samsung monitor I paired with the computer does have a mic, but it doesn't work well with Zoom or with Facetime calls. I strongly prefer not to use a headset in most situations.This microphone looks like a small flash drive, and plugs into a USB-A socket. The only thing that makes it distinguishable from a thumb drive is the circular group of holes around the microphone element. It appears as a "USB PnP Sound Device," and configures readily in MacOS and Windows 10/11.The sound quality is quite good - it has excellent sensitivity, and people I have talked to say my audio is clear and crisp. It's a nondirectional microphone, so it may not work ideally in busy offices or public spaces.The device comes with a cute Altoids-sized black tin with a foam lining and a rubberized USB jack cover for transport.For my needs - occasional online chats and Facetime cellular calls, it is exactly what I was hoping for.
